comment: I was a little weary about taking a Math class. After almost 20 years, Mrs. Sellers was the best I could have asked for. I thank her for her patience and assistance. Come to class and do the work. Seek help if needed. You pay for the Math Lab, use it, It also helped me.
She's nice. If you attend class, take notes. Attendance isn't mandatory. You can use notes on the test (Mathway). She'll make changes to your test if she see fit.

Ms. Sellers was the bomb! As long as you show up, do the homework (which are 10 problems a week) and do the practice tests ( I usually would do about 4-5 before the actual test) then you should be ok. She was extremely helpful and I had no trouble following her in class. Do the homework on the site as well bc that helped me.

I took her for math97 and she was really helpful in making things clear. There was homework about once a week but only 10 problems and she lets you turn in late homework for full credit. She's really understanding and will let you make up a test if you can't attend class.

Im not to fond of miss sellers. She goes through all of her lessons too fast. she will explain the lesson once and wont really take the time to make sure everyone understands. If you stay after class to ask her questions it seem like she gets irritated.
She is confusing. If you are someone that gets confused easily, do not take her class. Find another teacher that really knows how to teach.

I absolutely love this Professor! She is so nice, and very helpful! She will meet you before class and stay after if you need extra help. She knows her math too!I hate math, but her class I didnt mind.
